Sure! For a 12th-grade calculus lesson on the topic of derivation, I can provide you with some relevant resources and activities to enhance your students' learning.

Resources:
1. Textbook: You can refer to the calculus textbook used in your curriculum as a primary resource for teaching the topic of derivation.

2. Khan Academy: This online platform offers a range of video lessons and practice exercises on calculus. You can search for their calculus lessons on derivation and select the specific topics you want to cover in your lesson.

3. MathisFun: This website provides clear explanations and interactive activities on various mathematical topics. They have a section dedicated to calculus, where you can explore the lessons on derivation.

4. BrainPOP: This educational platform offers animated videos, quizzes, and activities to make learning entertaining. They have a section on calculus that includes content on derivatives, which could be helpful for your lesson.

Activities:
1. Derivative Exploration: Provide students with a set of functions and ask them to find the derivatives for each one. This will help reinforce their understanding of the derivative rules and how they apply to different functions.

2. Application Problems: Give students real-life scenarios or word problems that can be solved using derivatives. This activity will help them apply the concept of derivatives to practical situations.

3. Graph Analysis: Show your students various graphs and ask them to analyze the behavior of the derivative at different points. This will deepen their understanding of how derivatives can indicate slope, concavity, and critical points.

4. Calculus Apps: Encourage students to explore and use calculus-related apps, such as Desmos or GeoGebra, that offer interactive graphing and calculus features. This will allow them to experiment with derivatives and visualize their concepts.

Remember to adapt the resources and activities to meet the specific needs and learning objectives of your students. I hope these suggestions help you in planning your calculus lesson on derivation! If you have any more specific questions or need further assistance, feel free to ask.
